result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah S Schenk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
*Up to one half of the time may be served on home monitor program if Defendant qualifies through Sheriff's Department
*2 Days Jail Credit

Consecutive to: 14CT113 but concurrent to 14CM239

miscConds.notes:
*Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations. If agent chooses, may accept the DOT assessment or other assessments that agent is satisfied with
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
*Need consent of agent if Defendant is in a bar/tavern which is primary business
*Obtain and maintain full time employment or school or a combination to equal full time
*Participate in counseling as recommended by the agent

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leah S Schenk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Portage County Community Justice Program/Court Referral Form

Defendant Leah S Schenk in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CT-113, 15CM-306 and 14CM-239.

10:44 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court did receive a copy of the ATTIC report.
Address is verified.

Court has received a report about Defendant.
Both counsel received their copy as well.

There is a plea agreeement.
14CT-113: Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed.
14CM-239: Defendant is pleading to single count.
15CM-306: Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.

Atty Renc concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CT-113: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CM-239: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-306: Count 1:  NO CONTEST

Court corrects plea questionnaire as to correct file number.
Atty Renc does not object.
Atty Cousins does not object.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Defense agrees that this is a 3rd offense OWI since January 01, 1989.
Atty Renc has a copy of the lab report from 14CT-113.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CT-113: Count 1: OWI 3rd
14CT-113: Count 2: Dismissed
14CM-239: Misdemeanor Bailjumping
15CM-306: Count 1: Obstructing an Officer
15CM-306: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests the Court to join in the joint recommendation,  days jail credit.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing, Court finds plea agreement fair and appropriate. Court agrees with counsel's comments.

BY THE COURT:
14CT-113:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 120 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Post Sentence Probation Supervision Program for a period of 1 Year
Conditions:
Jail sentence of 45 Days
5 Days Credit
First 14 days in custody and balance on electronic monitoring program
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Pay a fine and costs totaling $3,976.00
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
60 days to pay or set up payment plan and comply with the plan
Drivers License Revoked 35 Months
IID 35 Months
DOT Assessment and comply with driver safety plan - BAC: .278

14CM-239:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Jail sentence is consecutive to 14CT-113
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Up to one half of the time may be served on home monitor program if Defendant qualifies through Sheriff's Department
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations. If agent chooses, may accept the DOT assessment or other assessments that agent is satisfied with
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Need consent of agent if Defendant is in a bar/tavern which is primary business
Obtain and maintain full time employment or school or a combination to equal full time
Participate in counseling as recommended by the agent

15CM-306:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to 14CM-239
Jail sentence is consecutive to 14CT-113
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Up to one half of the time may be served on home monitor program if Defendant qualifies through Sheriff's Department
2 Days Jail Credit
Probation for a period of 18 Months, concurrent to 14CM-239
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CM-239
Pay costs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leah S Schenk in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint.  15CM306 is heard as initial appearance and 14CM239 and 14CT113 are status today.
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
The $1,500 bond that covers all files is Bond continued.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Resisting/Obstructing, Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/27/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

BY THE COURT:  Bond is this file is covered by 14CM239.
